greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = numerator of squared radius R^2 of the circumcircle of the n-th non-obtuse triangle with integer sides i <= j <= k <= sqrt(i^2 + j^2) in a list of such triangles, the list being sorted by increasing size of R. Denominators are A331223.
comment: Radii shared by more than one triangle are not removed. The first occurrence is for squared radius 49/3 at positions n = 41 and n = 42.
formula: Squared radius of circumcircle of triangle with sides a, b, c:
example: The first terms b(n) = a(n)/A331223(n) correspond to the following triangles (i, j, k):
